channel.title: Xbox 360 RROD
channel.description: Well a few months ago i got the RROD on my 360 ( it had lasted 2 years..) So yesterday i decided to fix it myself rather than sending it in. Whats causing the problem is heat sink on the CPU and the GPU in the 360. So i dismantled it, scraped off the old heat sink, cleaned it, and replaced it with new, put it back together and tried it out..Before i started out it was giving me the 3 rings (1,3,4) but now when i do it it'll give me 2 rings (over heated) and then ill turn it off and try again, and it'll give me 3 rings. Did i miss something, or is my 360 bricked.

item.title: Xbox 360 RROD
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

The way my brother fixed his 360 was by getting a rubber cork and cutting it into bits, then he jammed them under the ram chips. (It pushes them back intothe solder.)

It has worked fine ever since.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 RROD
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Tico135, post:9, topic:252669”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=333759.msg2600116#msg2600116 date=1230177769]

I fixed my old 360, all you have to do is replace the thermal glue and reheat the connection between the Heat sync and the CPU.
[/quote]I did that…minus the reheating part…How would one do that

I can’t remember now, try google.

Actually there are several youtube videos on how to fix rrod.[/quote]
Thanks for pointing out the obvious.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 RROD
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:5, topic:252669”][quote author=Kane. link=topic=333759.msg2599911#msg2599911 date=1230168149]
I’m really shit with fixing things and break anything I touch, so there’s no way I’m opening my 360.
Until I’m actually bothered to play XBL or a new game I’m not paying $130 to get it fixed.

It’s not entirely broken, the graphics have just really fucked up (Melted something in there) - Get 2 rings, sometimes, and sometimes it works. But, looks like it has barcodes all over the screen.
[/quote]
My 360 got the system error red ring today, it was easy to fix. My other 360 had an unknown error code, turns out it was both, overheating, and a AV cable. :P[/quote]
They’re so flawed. It’s shit that this error isn’t covered by warranty.

I hardly play it anymore, so it doesn’t bother me.

Read full topic

@Yz85Racer wrote:

I fixed my old 360, all you have to do is replace the thermal glue and reheat the connection between the Heat sync and the CPU.

item.title: Xbox 360 RROD

item.description:
@Frell wrote:

idk but if you dont get it working you have to buy a new one. Warranty doesnt cover attempting to fix yourself.
